Standard steels

Ascometal® offers the whole product range used for the numerous applications of Mechanical Engineering:

a complete range of carbon and alloy steels meeting national and international standards.

  • Through & Surface Hardening steels
  • Case-hardening steels
  • Bearing steels
  • Spring steels
  • Induction hardening steels
  • Steels for fasteners
  • Steels for nitriding, carburizing
  • Tool steels
  • 9% and 13% Chromium steels

 

Grades brochure

Special steels and standard steels

meca / ac standards

Non alloy Engineering steel, compliant with European standards: NF EN10083-1 and 2, NF EN 10273, NF EN 10025-2 and 3 and international ones

Case-hardening steels: Euronorm 10084

Adapted consistent alloy content analysis to better fit the thermo chemical treatment as well as the in-use conditions. Possibility to optimize alloy content to better withstand machining or forming process (controlled inclusions). Fine grain steel. High inclusion cleanliness grades to improve resistance to fatigue or pitting.

Through and Surface hardening steel compliant with Euronorm: 10083-1 – 10083-2

Mechanical Engineering steel for QT. These grades offer good toughness after QT. Good machinability properties can be obtained while optimizing microstructure and inclusion shape.

Nitriding steels: Euronorm 10085 / DIN 17211

Grades suitable for nitriding treatment. The presence of nitride forming elements contributes to the creation of a high surface hardness and / or increases the efficient nitriding depth.
